definition: blurred vision of an old person (idiom)

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: Jacob sneaks under the cover of Isaac's blindness and steals away with his father's blessings.
sentences.chinese: 雅各乘以撒老眼昏花，狡猾地骗取了父亲的祝福。

definition: a mistake/an oversight/an error of judgment
unfit for anything/no good/useless/(of a sick person) beyond hope
(idiom) blind as a bat (figuratively)/unaware of who (or what) one is dealing with/to fail to recognize what sb a bit more perceptive would
see 老頭子|老头子[lao3 tou2 zi5]
to approach one's coffin (idiom); with one foot in the grave
(coll.) old man/(said of an aging husband) my old man
